questionsData.title: Alkali comes into English from Arabic.
Vapor and steam are synonyms.
A cat is covered in skin.
Round, curved and square are kinds of shapes.
" Holiday" means "not being at work".
A farmer uses generator to turn the soil over.
questionsData.explain_answer:
A farmer uses tractors to turn the soil over.

Tractors are used to turn over soil , while generators are engines that produce electricity .

questionsData.title: Sound is created by something that is not vibrating .
A volcano is a mountain with a hole on the top.
A drought is a water shortage after a long period with no rain.
" Flattened " means "blown down to the ground" .
"Fall down" means "collapse"
"To vaccine" means "to protect a person or an animal from a disease".
"Offering" means" saying you can't have".
The strength of the earthquake is measured on the microscope.
A person who applies for a job is an applicant.
A suffix is a group of letters that goes in front of the stem.
Things you use in cooking are ingredients.
"Harvest" means "to take from trees".
Lunar eclipse is the moon eclipse.
A group of connected words is called word set.
The text is mainly talking about …………….
questionsData.article: Colors affect everyone. We think carefully about color when we choose our clothes or select paint fora roam. But we are often Unaware of how color affect us. Colors in nature have universal meaning, For example, trees and plants are green, so the color green represents life and nature, Blue, the color of the sky, oceans and lakes make us think of air, water and peace, Colors red, yellow, orange, blue, green and purple in spectrum may give us feelings of warmth and comfort or feelings of anger, They often give us a feeling of calmness or sadness, Humans have known about the power of colors for a long time. Ancient cultures in China, Egypt and India use colors to heal sickness, People believe that each color had a healing power, For example, blue decreases pain. The researchers are finding that colors affect our emotions and can change our behavior in specific ways. Colors can affect how people think, feel and act.

questionsData.title: He is as …… as a horse.
He was very sad. ….. , he smiled.
The shopping area is ….. than school.
I heard a little girl …. in the garden.
Fatima is going to ….. her school.
Stop talking! I can't hear what he …..
questionsData.explain_answer:
Stop talking! I can't hear what he's saying.  (Sense verbs)

  • "Is saying" refers to the present moment, which wouldn't make sense since you're saying you can't hear him.
  • "Has said" refers to something that was already said in the past, but you're indicating you can't hear him right now.
  • "Said" could technically work, but "saying" is more natural-sounding in this context where you want the person to stop talking immediately.
  • "Had said" implies something completed entirely in the past, similar to "has said".
